Field Detail

J_BUFF_SIZE

public static final int J_BUFF_SIZE
J_BUFF_SIZE-- Size of the buffer internal to the Java sound system. This parameter controls the latency in the response of the sound because a sample must traverse this internal buffer in a time given by t =J_BUFF_SIZE /(4* SAMPLE_RATE ). Make it too small, and you will have breaks in the sound; too big, and you increase latency in responses to user commands to change the output. This value corresponds to a command latency of approximately 0.07 seconds, or about 14.4 commands per second.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LATENCY_IN_MILLISECONDS

public static final int LATENCY_IN_MILLISECONDS
LATENCY_IN_MILLISECONDS-- the time between changes in the data stream and changes in the output sound. For default parameters, the value is approximately 70 milliseconds.

FUNDAMENTAL

public static final float FUNDAMENTAL
FUNDAMENTAL-- Commonly accepted pitch for A above middle C.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SAMPLE_RATE

public static final float SAMPLE_RATE
SAMPLE_RATE-- the perennial sampling rate equals 44,100 samples per second.

See Also:

source-- the object encapsulating the software which generates the waveforms to be rendered by the audio system.

Constructor Detail

MultiWavePlayer

protected MultiWavePlayer()
Disallows default constructor by throwing a RuntimeException.

MultiWavePlayer

public MultiWavePlayer(int maxTones)
Constructs a MultiWavePlayer with specified capacity for simultaneous tones.

Parameters:
maxTones - -- the maximum number of simultaneous tones which can be handled by this MultiWavePlayer.
Method Detail

initLine

public void initLine()
Allocates line, a new SourceDataLine for this MultiWavePlayer. opens and Starts line. Starts the player thread.

See Also:
line, SourceDataLine

setPan

public void setPan(float p)
Set the pan (left/right) values. It does what you might think Allowable, where the range for p = [-1, 1], with -1 corresponding to full left and 1 corresponding to full right.

Parameters:
p - the pan value.

setVolume

public void setVolume(float v)
Sets the volume level.

Parameters:
v - the volume level.

doPlay

public void doPlay()
Cranks the buffer-filling thread. Does nothing if MultiWavePlayer.play is true, i.e. the thread is already running If necessary, opens MultiWavePlayer.line.

doStop

public void doStop()
Stops playing, the buffer-filler-killer.

close

public void close()
Closes this MultiWavePlayer by calling hush then closes line.

isPlaying

public boolean isPlaying()
Return true if the thread is playing audio, otherwise false.

Returns:
true if the thread is playing audio, otherwise false.

getPan

public FloatControl getPan()
Returns the pan control for this MultiWavePlayer

Returns:
the FloatControl that controls stereo panning for this MultiWavePlayer
See Also:
FloatControl

isOpen

public boolean isOpen()
Returns the status of the SourceDataLine for this MultiWavePlayer.

Returns:
true if the SourceDataLine is non-null and open; false otherwise.
See Also:
MultiWave, SourceDataLine

getSource

public MultiWave getSource()
Gets the instance of MultiWave which is the source for this MultiWavePlayer.

Returns:
MultiWave source for this MultiWavePlayer
